reply.question: 1. Does the app declare the collection of data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the collection of data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that they collect various categories of personal information, implying the declaration of data collection.
reply.reference: As described in the Information We Collect section, we collect the categories of personal information listed below. We receive this information from you, your device, your use of the Services, third parties, and as otherwise described in this policy. URL: http://www.cognifit.com/privacy-policy

To the extent that information we collect is health data or another special category of personal data subject to the GDPR, we ask for your explicit consent to process the data. reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects identifiers, demographic information, health data, electronic/visual information, professional/educational/employment-related information, other user-provided information, geolocation data, and inferences drawn from the collected data.

reply.analysis: The app collects various types of data as mentioned in the Privacy Policy under different categories. These include personal identifiers, health-related data, professional information, and more.
reply.reference: Identifiers, demographic info, health data, electronic/visual info, professional/educational/employment-related info, other user-provided info, geolocation data, inferences drawn from the collected data. URL: http://www.cognifit.com/privacy-policy

reply.question: 3. Does the app declare the purpose of data collection and use?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the purpose of data collection and use.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that they use the information collected for various purposes such as customer support, safety, security, and sharing aggregate insights.
reply.reference: We use the information we collect for the following purposes...Provide and Maintain the Services...using personal data for the purposes described in this privacy policy.URL: http://www.cognifit.com/privacy-policy

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, users can opt out of data collection and delete their data by using their account settings and tools.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that users have the ability to control their personal data by accessing account settings and tools.
reply.reference: By logging into your account and using your account settings, you can change and delete your personal information. If you choose to delete your account, please note that all data, scores, and information will be permanently deleted. URL: http://www.cognifit.com/privacy-policy

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app shares data with third parties.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy states that CogniFit may partner with third parties, such as healthcare providers, pharmaceutical companies, employers, insurance companies, educational institutions, research facilities, health and wellness companies, and share personal information received from those organizations with them.
reply.reference: We may partner with third parties, such as healthcare providers, pharmaceutical companies, employers, insurance companies, educational institutions, research facilities, health and wellness companies, that offer CogniFit Services to their patients, customers, employees, clients, students, study participants and consumers. In such cases, those organizations may provide us with your name, email address, or similar information (like a telephone number or subscriber ID) so that we can invite you to participate or determine your eligibility for particular benefits, such as discounts or free services. URL: http://www.cognifit.com/privacy-policy

Information from Third-Party Services
If you choose to connect your account on our Services to your account on another service, we may receive information from the other service. For example, if you connect to Facebook or Twitter, we may receive information like your name, profile picture, age range, gender, language, email address, and friend list. You may also choose to grant us access to your exercise or activity data from another service. You can stop sha...

or to prevent, detect, or investigate illegal activity, fraud, abuse, violations of our terms, or threats to the security of the Services or the physical safety of any person.
Our policy is to notify you of legal process seeking access to your information, such as search warrants, court orders, or subpoenas, unless we are prohibited by law from doing so. In cases where a court order specifies a non-disclosure period, we provide delayed notice after the expiration of the non-disclosure period. Ex...

reply.question: 6. If the app shares data with third parties, what third parties does the app share data with?

answer.full_answer: Healthcare providers, pharmaceutical companies, employers, insurance companies, educational institutions, research facilities, health and wellness companies

extended_simple_answer.content: Healthcare providers, pharmaceutical companies, employers, insurance companies, educational institutions, research facilities, health and wellness companies

reply.analysis: The privacy policy mentions that CogniFit may partner with various third parties to offer services to their respective clients. These third parties include healthcare providers, pharmaceutical companies, employers, insurance companies, educational institutions, research facilities, and health and wellness companies. The app shares data with these entities based on the partnerships.
reply.reference: We may partner with third parties, such as healthcare providers, pharmaceutical companies, employers, insurance companies, educational institutions, research facilities, health and wellness companies, that offer CogniFit Services to their patients, customers, employees, clients, students, study participants and consumers. In such cases, those organizations may provide us with your name, email address, or similar information (like a telephone number or subscriber ID) so that we can invite you to participate or determine your eligibility for particular benefits, such as discounts or free services. URL: http://www.cognifit.com/privacy-policy
